e="preserve">Camillo Bazzoni (29 December 1934 – 8 October 2020) was an Italian cinematographer and movie director. He was born in Salsomaggiore Terme, Italy. His career began in 1960. From 1967 he worked as cinematographer with Lina Wertmüller, Mario Monicelli, Salvatore Samperi, Massimo Troisi, Franco Rossi.
His first movie as a director was "Suicide Commando", and a spaghetti western, "A Long Ride from Hell".
Bazzoni died on 8 October 2020 at the age of 85.
